snippet: Lawyers for a man injured by another prisoner at Rikers Island in 2010 believe a surveillance video would have shown that officers stood by during the beating, a claim New York City officials deny.
abstract: Lawyers for Kadeem John, beaten by another prisoner while in a unit for teenagers at New York City's Rikers Island prison complex in 2010, charge that a surveillance video showing staff complicity in the assault was deliberately destroyed; city’s failure to preserve the recording has sparked an intense legal dispute, with Judge Robert P Patterson of federal court in Manhattan agreeing to impose sanctions on the city that could complicate its ability to defend against John's lawsuit.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers for a man injured by another prisoner at Rikers Island in 2010 believe a surveillance video would have shown that officers stood by during the beating, a claim New York City officials deny.

headline.seo: Destroyed Surveillance Video Called Key to Inmate’s Lawsuit
headline.main: Video That City Destroyed Is Cited in Inmate’s Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: Video Cited In Jail Suit Wasn't Kept
